info.title: Monaco API
info.description: A RESTful API that allows you to interact with the Monaco Exchange. Provides endpoints for managing Events, Markets, Sessions, Wallets and Orders. To interact with the API, a client must have an App Id and an API Key to authenticate and create a session.

post.summary: Create session for a given credentials
Refresh session for a given token

get.summary: Fetch orders by filters. At least one of the following filter parameters must be supplied: ids, appIds, eventIds, marketIds, walletIds, references. Page size limit 500.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: Header with the accessToken for the current session

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: list of order ids to filter by

parameters.name: appIds
parameters.description: list of apps to filter by

parameters.name: eventIds
parameters.description: list of events to filter by

parameters.name: marketIds
parameters.description: list of markets to filter by

parameters.name: walletIds
parameters.description: list of wallets to filter by

parameters.name: references
parameters.description: list of references to filter by - requires appId to be provided also

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description:
statuses to filter by - valid values to choose are as follows:
  • Cancelled - Orders that have not matched and have been cancelled either on request or automatically
  • Matched - Orders that have been matched, either fully or partially, where the remaining unmatched stake has been cancelled, either on request or automatically
  • PartiallyMatched - Orders that have been partially matched, and the remaining unmatched portion might still be matched
  • Unmatched - Orders that have not yet been matched, and the remaining unmatched portion might still be matched
  • Won - Previously Matched orders that have been deemed to have Won at the time of market settlement
  • Lost - Previously Matched orders that have been deemed to have Lost at the time of market settlement
  • Voided - All orders belonging to markets that have been voided

items.description:
The status of an order can be one of the following
  • Cancelled - The order was not matched and has been cancelled either on request or automatically
  • Matched - The order has been matched, either fully, or partially where the remaining unmatched stake has been cancelled, either on request or automatically
  • PartiallyMatched - The order has been partially matched, and the remaining unmatched portion might still be matched
  • Unmatched - The order has not yet been matched, and the remaining unmatched portion might still be matched
  • Won - The market has been settled and this previously Matched order has been deemed to have Won
  • Lost - The market has been settled and this previously Matched order has been deemed to have Lost
  • Voided - The market has been voided so this order has been voided

parameters.name: fromStake
parameters.description: beginning of the stake range filter (inclusive)

parameters.name: toStake
parameters.description: end of the stake range filter (inclusive)

parameters.name: fromCreatedAt
parameters.description: beginning of the creation date range filter (inclusive)

parameters.name: toCreatedAt
parameters.description: end of the creation date range filter (inclusive)

parameters.name: matchBehavior
parameters.description:
Optional - How any unmatched portion of an order is treated:
  • RetainUnmatched - unmatched portion persists as an offer (default)
  • CancelUnmatched - unmatched portion is cancelled

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page index (0..N)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property,(asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: Header with the accessToken for the current session

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: Header with the accessToken for the current session

post.summary: Cancel orders owned by the caller by event and/or market; skips invalid markets/orders

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: Header with the accessToken for the current session

parameters.name: walletIds
parameters.description: list of wallets to filter the orders to be cancelled

parameters.name: eventIds
parameters.description: list of event IDs to filter the orders to be cancelled

parameters.name: marketIds
parameters.description: list of market IDs to filter the orders to be cancelled

parameters.name: orderIds
parameters.description: list of order IDs to filter the orders to be cancelled

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: Header with the accessToken for the current session

get.summary: Returns a paginated list of markets based on the provided filter and ordering criteria. This can get specific known markets (by market ID), or markets based on other criteria such as event ID(s) and/or market type and status etc.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: Header with the accessToken for the current session

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Optional list of specific IDs to fetch

parameters.name: ownerAppIds
parameters.description: Optional list of app IDs to filter results by

parameters.name: eventIds
parameters.description: Optional list of event IDs to filter results by

parameters.name: marketTypeIds
parameters.description: Optional list of market type IDs to filter results by

parameters.name: currencyIds
parameters.description: Optional list of currency IDs to filter results by

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: Optional list of market statuses to filter results by

parameters.name: inPlayStatuses
parameters.description: Whether the markets are currently in-play or not. Returns all if not set

parameters.name: fromDateTime
parameters.description: The inclusive beginning of a date-time range filter. If not provided, no restriction will be applied to the beginning of the range

parameters.name: toDateTime
parameters.description: The exclusive end of a date-time range filter. If not provided, no restriction will be applied to the end of the range

parameters.name: published
parameters.description: Optional filter as to whether the market is published or not

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page index (0..N)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property,(asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

parameters.description: Header with the accessToken for the current session

parameters.name: toCreatedAt

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page index (0..N)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property,(asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

get.summary: Fetch a list of supported currencies
get.description: Returns the list of currencies supported by the exchange

parameters.description: Header with the accessToken for the current session

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: app id

matchBehavior.description:
Optional - How any unmatched portion of an order is treated:
  • RetainUnmatched - unmatched portion persists as an offer (default)
  • CancelUnmatched - unmatched portion is cancelled

commissionRateId.description:
Optional - to use a different commission rate for this order than your app's
default commission rate. If omitted or set to null, the app's default
commission rate will be used (if it has one).
